statement: Circle which are facts vs opinions: 'The sky is blue.' / 'Ice cream is the best.'
how_to: 1) Is it observable/measurable? 2) If yes → fact; if not → opinion.
expected_outcome: Label each statement and write one sentence why.

statement: A social post claims a supplement cured headaches. Identify whether it's a fact or opinion and the evidence needed.
how_to: 1) Check for cited studies. 2) Seek independent sources. 3) Note missing controls.
expected_outcome: A short credibility note and list of evidence to verify.

statement: A report says 'X% increase after campaign Y'. Evaluate if this is causal or correlational.
how_to: 1) Seek baseline & controls. 2) Ask for methodology. 3) Suggest data to confirm causality.
expected_outcome: A short critique with data requests.

statement: A friend lost a toy and is sad. What can you say to show you care?
how_to: 1) Name the feeling. 2) Ask a gentle question. 3) Offer help.
expected_outcome: Empathetic lines to comfort a friend.

statement: A groupmate is upset about a grade. Practice a response that listens and asks specifics.
how_to: 1) Paraphrase their concern. 2) Ask clarifying question. 3) Offer to help.

statement: A colleague is defensive in a meeting. Show a de-escalating phrase + follow-up question.
how_to: 1) Acknowledge their point. 2) Use 'I' statements. 3) Ask about goals.
1) Pick core words. 2) Use nouns/verbs to compress meaning.

statement: Summarize a book in 10 words keeping main idea.
how_to: 1) Identify main idea. 2) Compress to core nouns/verbs.

statement: Describe your job in 10 words for a recruiter.
Explain 'money' to an alien who has never traded.
how_to: 1) Use concrete examples. 2) Avoid cultural terms.

statement: Explain 'school' to an alien; avoid assuming literacy in English.
Explain 'taxes' focusing on purpose rather than local rules.
how_to: 1) Describe collective services & funding. 2) Use non-cultural analogies.

statement: Make a short claim and one simple reason.
Give a claim, one piece of evidence, and one counterargument.
Prepare a position with evidence and two plausible counterarguments.
Explain why your class project is cool in one sentence.
how_to: 1) Focus on benefit. 2) Keep it simple.

statement: 30-second pitch for a school club idea.
how_to: 1) Problem → idea → benefit. 2) Add one action step.
